name: Christmas
description: Christmas is a joyous holiday celebrated on December 25th each year, where Christians commemorate the birth of Jesus Christ with traditions including gift-giving, festive decorations, and gatherings with loved ones.

name: Halloween
description: Halloween is an autumnal celebration on October 31st marked by costumes, spooky decorations, and trick-or-treating, rooted in ancient Celtic and Christian traditions.

name: Independence Day (US)
description: Independence Day, celebrated on July 4th in the United States, commemorates the country's declaration of independence from British rule in 1776 with fireworks, parades, and patriotic festivities.

name: St. Patrick's Day
description: Celebrated on March 17, St. Patrick's Day honors St. Patrick, the patron saint of Ireland. It features parades, wearing green, and public festivals with Irish food, music, and dancing. Symbols include shamrocks and leprechauns.

name: Easter
description: Easter celebrates the resurrection of Jesus Christ. It falls on the first Sunday after the first full moon post-vernal equinox. Traditions include church services, egg hunts, and festive meals. The Easter Bunny is a popular symbol.

name: Thanksgiving
description: Thanksgiving, on the fourth Thursday in November, is a U.S. holiday for giving thanks and celebrating the harvest. It features family gatherings and a meal with turkey, stuffing, and pumpkin pie. It also marks the start of the Christmas shopping season.

name: Valentine's Day
description: Valentine's Day, on February 14, celebrates love and affection between partners. Traditions include exchanging cards, flowers, and gifts, as well as romantic dinners. It originated as a feast day for Saint Valentine.

name: New Year's Day (US)
description: New Year's Day, on January 1, marks the start of the year. Celebrations begin on New Year's Eve with parties and fireworks. At midnight, people toast, cheer, and make resolutions for the new year. It's a time for hope and renewal.

name: Sal's Birthday
description: A day celebrating the birth of our good friend Sal. Traditionally, we salvage a salivary salami salad in salutation of Sal.
